title: Drawing, "Radio City Music Hall: Console Table", August 24, 1932
medium: Graphite, red color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/145 WEST 57TH STREET/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 6097/F.S./H./8/24/32/R.C. 101; center, above perspective drawing: 3 TABLES IN RM. # 02 FASTEN TO MIRROR FRAME BY ANGLES/1 TABLE " " 304 " " FLOOR BY ANCHORS & SCREWS; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for small console table. Plans indicate for four tables to be made; three for room # 02, and one (larger) for room # 304. Rectangular top of table in black Bakelite; U-shaped leg structure made of three narrow aluminum straps, connected at top with six aluminum balls on each side. Narrow, squared rectangular bars at left and right as base for legs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Radio City Music Hall: Console Table", August 24, 1932.
August 24, 1932. Graphite, red color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-720.
